conversation.text: I would recommend "Mama". The movie follows Ever since surviving a domestic violence attack, Kim Addison has found the courage to take matters into her own hands. After learning MMA training in order to learn self- defense, Kim found the confidence to become a trainer herself. She has since set out to help others who have been victims of bullying and abuse just like her. Kim' s personal mission is to empower, inspire and train women and children so they too can stand up for themselves against bullying. Among her students is 13- year- old Logan Chauvin. Logan was terrorized daily in school by callous bullies. He has been training vigorously with Kim to overcome his experience and is now getting ready for his first real MMA fight. Although Kim has done everything in her power to train Logan to stand up to bullies at school, there is very little she can do to protect him from his first real MMA opponent.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Pianist" as a potential recommendation.

"The Pianist" is a drama film that tells the story of Wladyslaw Szpilman, a renowned Polish pianist who was forced to flee his country during World War II due to persecution and violence against him and other Poles.  After fleeing Europe, Szpilman spent years hiding in the ruins of cities such as Warsaw, Budapest, and Leningrad. Despite living in secret for so many years, Szpilman never lost touch with his music or fellow musicians. Over time, Szpilman was able to rebuild his life and career.
